evs.data
Class DateCondition

java.lang.Object
  evs.data.Condition
      evs.data.DateCondition

public class DateCondition
extends Condition

A class for specifying date restrictions on a verification unit. A date condition can be set once the start and end dates of the verification unit have been defined.

Version:
4.0
Author:
evs@hydrosolved.com

          The verification unit associated with this condition.

getCondition

public java.util.Vector<java.lang.Integer> getCondition(DateElement dateElement)
Returns a vector of date positions to exclude with respect to the specified date condition or null if the condition has not been defined. The vector comprises zero-based indices of those elements that will NOT be included in the verification. For example, an index of 1 associated with Calendar.MONTH would imply that February was not included in the verification.

Parameters:
dateElement - the date element
Returns:
the specified condition or null

getConditions

public java.util.TreeMap<DateElement,java.util.Vector<java.lang.Integer>> getConditions()
Returns the integer set of date elements to exclude.

Returns:
the elements to exclude

getConditionsValidTime

public java.util.TreeMap<DateElement,java.util.Vector<java.lang.Integer>> getConditionsValidTime()
Returns the integer set of date elements to exclude in valid time. If no conditions are defined in valid time, returns an empty map.

Returns:
the elements to exclude

getConditionsBasisTime

public java.util.TreeMap<DateElement,java.util.Vector<java.lang.Integer>> getConditionsBasisTime()
Returns the integer set of date elements to exclude in basis time. If no conditions are defined in basis time, returns an empty map.

Returns:
the elements to exclude

apply

public BooleanMatrix1D apply(DoubleMatrix2D data,
                             int dataType)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Applies the condition, returning a 1D matrix of boolean values whose elements indicate which rows should be used, where true indicates a row should be used. The input data may contain either observed data (i.e. two columns, with valid time and observations), forecasts (valid time, lead time, and members) or paired data (valid time, lead time, observations and members).

Specified by:
apply in class Condition
Parameters:
data - the data
dataType - the data type
Returns:
the rows that should be used given the condition
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

setCondition

public final void setCondition(DateElement dateElement,
                               java.util.Vector<java.lang.Integer> exclude)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Sets a date condition. Specify the verification unit to which the condition applies. In addition, specify the date element and the vector of identifiers to exclude. The identifiers for all date elements are zero-based. The following date elements are zero, and increment upwards: Calendar.YEAR: the first year in start Calendar.DAY_OF_WEEK: Monday Calendar.WEEK_OF_YEAR: First week Calendar.MONTH_OF_YEAR: January Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY: 0Z

Parameters:
dateElement - the date element
exclude - the vector of integer identifiers to exclude
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

deepCopy

public Condition deepCopy()
Returns a deep copy of the verification condition.

Specified by:
deepCopy in class Condition
Returns:
a deep copy

translateEVSToCal

public int translateEVSToCal(int element,
                             int evsID)
Returns a Calendar identifier that corresponds to the input integer. The identifiers for the EVS elements are zero-based. The following date elements are zero, and increment upwards: Calendar.DAY_OF_WEEK: Monday Calendar.WEEK_OF_YEAR: First week Calendar.MONTH: January Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY: 0Z Thus, for example, an input of Calendar.DAY_OF_WEEK and 0 will return the corresponding calendar identifier Calendar.MONDAY. Throws an exception if the EVS identifier is inconsistent with the range of the date class element (e.g. 27 for hour of day)

Parameters:
element - the date class from Calendar
evsID - the EVS identifier for the date element
Returns:
the identifier from Calendar

translateCalToEVS

public int translateCalToEVS(int element,
                             int calID)
Returns an EVS date identifier that corresponds to the input Calendar integer. The identifiers for the EVS elements are zero-based. The following date elements are zero, and increment upwards: Calendar.DAY_OF_WEEK: Monday Calendar.WEEK_OF_YEAR: First week Calendar.MONTH: January Calendar.HOUR_OF_DAY: 0Z Thus, for example, an input of Calendar.DAY_OF_WEEK and Calendar.MONDAY will return the EVS ID of 0. Throws an exception if the input identifier is inconsistent with the range of the input date class element (e.g. 27 for hour of day)

Parameters:
element - the date class from Calendar
calID - the Calendar identifier for the date element
Returns:
the EVS identifier
